p: Overview: Laurus nobilis L. is a member of the family, Lauraceae, that comprises 32 genera and about 2000â€“2500 species. Laurus is also known as sweet bay, Grecian laurel, true bay, bay tree, and bay laurel. Its natural habitat is the tropical and sub-tropical Himalayas areas. Turkey, Algeria, France, Greece, Morocco, Portugal, Spain, Belgium, Mexico, Central America, and the Southern United States are the main commercial production centres of bay laurel [ 115, 116].
